fields.headline: The prize quiz
fields.bodyText: Jeff Randall is business editor of the BBC. On the rare occasions that the corporation allows him out of Television Centre (only ever with small amounts of change), he goes to the ballet, visits modern art galleries and does good works. Er, actually that's rubbish. He watches football, plays golf and bets on horses. The rest of his free time, he wastes. · Jeff Randall donated his fee for setting this quiz to the Royal British Legion's Poppy Appeal. Each week, a different guest quizmaster sets five questions per day, Monday to Friday. Send us your answers to all 25 questions at the end of the week and the first correct entry out of the hat will win a £100 electronic gift card from Borders (www.bordersstores.co.uk). E1 Where is the home base of Wal-Mart? a) Birmingham, Alabama b) Bentonville, Arkansas c) Gainesville, Florida d) Austin, Texas E2 Where is the home base of McDonald's? a) Oak Brook, Illinois b) Downey, California c) Des Moines, Iowa d) Omaha, Nebraska E3 Where is the home base of Coca-Cola? a) Atlanta, Georgia b) Las Vegas, Nevada c) Washington DC d) New York, New York E4 Where is the home base of Ford Motor Company? a) Buffalo, New York b) Dearborn, Michigan c) Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania d) Trenton, New Jersey E5 Where is the home base of Disney? a) Burbank, California b) San Francisco, California c) La Jolla, California d) San Diego, California · Entries must reach Prize Quiz, The Guardian, 119 Farringdon Road, London EC1R 3ER by Wednesday August 25. The winner will be notified by August 27. One entry per person. No purchase necessary. The daily online news quiz is at: theguardian.com/quiz.
